com.mokiat.data.front.scanner

Class OBJLimitingScannerHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mokiat.data.front.scanner.OBJLimitingScannerHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOBJScannerHandler

    public class OBJLimitingScannerHandler
extends Object
implements IOBJScannerHandler
    This implementation of the IOBJScannerHandler assures that all events do not exceed a custom specified threshold. Should that happen, an WFSizeException is thrown.

    Most common usage of this class is to assure that during loading the file is within reasonable size and that the application will not fail with an OutOfMemoryError.

    This class implements the decorator pattern, so you need to specify another handler to which all events will be forwarded after they have passed a threshold check.

    Author:
    Momchil Atanasov

      • OBJLimitingScannerHandler

        public OBJLimitingScannerHandler(IOBJScannerHandler delegate,
                                 OBJLimits limits)
        Creates a new OBJLimitingScannerHandler with the specified delegate IOBJScannerHandler and OBJLimits.
        Parameters:
        delegate - handler to which events will be delegated on success.
        limits - object specifying the scanning limits after which an WFSizeException is thrown.
        See Also:
        OBJLimits

      • onFaceBegin

        public void onFaceBegin()
                 throws WFException
        Description copied from interface: IOBJScannerHandler
        Called when a face definition (f) is being read.

        You can expect the IOBJScannerHandler.onDataReference(IFastInt, IFastInt, IFastInt) to be called a number of times. Each such data reference should be considered part of this face.

        Specified by:
        onFaceBegin in interface IOBJScannerHandler
        Throws:
        WFException - can be thrown by users to terminate any further scanning of the resource.

      • onDataReference

        public void onDataReference(IFastInt vertexIndex,
                            IFastInt texCoordIndex,
                            IFastInt normalIndex)
                     throws WFException
        Description copied from interface: IOBJScannerHandler
        Called when a data reference segment has been read.

        These segments reference vertices, texture coordinates and normals through the use of indices. Note: Positive indices start from 1 and negative indices are allowed, where -1 means the last read until this moment referenced element.

        Specified by:
        onDataReference in interface IOBJScannerHandler
        Parameters:
        vertexIndex - index of the referenced vertex, will not be null.
        texCoordIndex - optional index of the referenced texture coordinate, will be null if unavailable.
        normalIndex - optional index of the referenced normal coordinate, will be null if unavailable.
        Throws:
        WFException - can be thrown by users to terminate any further scanning of the resource.

      • onMaterialLibrary

        public void onMaterialLibrary(String libraryFilename)
                       throws WFException
        Description copied from interface: IOBJScannerHandler
        Called when a filename from a material library declaration (mtllib) has been read.

        Resolving and loading of the given library file is left to the user.

        Specified by:
        onMaterialLibrary in interface IOBJScannerHandler
        Parameters:
        libraryFilename - filename of a material library to be used.
        Throws:
        WFException - can be thrown by users to terminate any further scanning of the resource.

      • onMaterialReference

        public void onMaterialReference(String materialName)
                         throws WFException
        Description copied from interface: IOBJScannerHandler
        Called when a material reference (usemtl) has been read.

        Per specification, it is allowed for this method to provide a null material name. In this case a default white material should be used.

        Specified by:
        onMaterialReference in interface IOBJScannerHandler
        Parameters:
        materialName - name of the material to use for subsequent elements
        Throws:
        WFException - can be thrown by users to terminate any further scanning of the resource.
